subject: Personal Finance
title: The Power of Defaults
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Power of Defaults.

hook.text: When companies auto-enroll employees in 401(k) plans, participation jumps from 49% to 86%.

buildup.text: Default settings have enormous power because most people never change them.

discovery.text: Behavioral economists call this 'choice architecture.' Who sets the default shapes the outcome.

twist.text: The same principle works against you. Default subscription renewals and pre-checked boxes exploit inertia.

climax.text: Setting your own defaults â€” automatic savings, automatic investing â€” uses inertia in your favor.

punchline.text: Design your defaults to work for you.
